properties.title: The New York Earth Room
properties.description: An installation by Walter De Maria featuring a room filled with 250 cubic yards of earth, highlighting the relationship between humans and the environment.

properties.title: Plastic Waste Tower
properties.description: A towering sculpture made entirely from discarded plastic bottles, symbolizing the overwhelming problem of plastic pollution.

properties.title: Toxic Garden
properties.description: An installation by Agnes Meyer-Brandis that features a garden filled with plants, some real, some artificial, that represent the consequences of toxic waste on ecosystems.

properties.title: Submerged Sculpture
properties.description: A series of submerged sculptures off the coast of New York, designed to grow into coral reefs, serving as artificial habitats for marine life.

properties.title: River of Time
properties.description: A visual installation in Berlin made of thousands of plastic bottles, arranged to depict the passage of time and the rise of environmental degradation.

properties.title: The Water Table
properties.description: An interactive art installation by Anne Percoco, where visitors walk through water-filled trenches, emphasizing the vulnerability of freshwater resources.

properties.title: Forest of Plastic
properties.description: A sculptural installation in the Black Forest made entirely from plastic debris found in the area, raising awareness about waste in natural environments.

properties.title: Climate Clock
properties.description: A digital clock installation in London that shows the time remaining until the global climate emergency reaches a critical point.

properties.title: Air Tree
properties.description: An interactive tree-like sculpture created from air filters to draw attention to the pollution levels in the city of Cambridge.
